definition: to take care of oneself
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
heavy/serious/to attach importance to
to repeat/repetition/again/re-/classifier: layer
take good care of yourself!

sentences.english: William rehearse played the pain, and the demand notice to take care of health.
sentences.chinese: 威廉排戲辛苦了，需要注意保重身體。

sentences.english: Its a shame you had to go so fast but take care anyway.
sentences.chinese: 真可惜你那麼快又要走了，不管怎樣，一路保重。

sentences.english: Father, you want to take care of health, little drink, is all right?
sentences.chinese: 爸爸，您要保重身體，少喝酒，行嗎？

sentences.english: Williams, I know filming is very tough and tiring, Please take care of your health.
sentences.chinese: 威廉排戲辛苦了，需要注意保重身體。

sentences.english: Dear friend, may you keep well.
sentences.chinese: 親愛的朋友，請多多保重。

sentences.english: Word last night was Jefferson was crushed by the trade, but take solace, Big Al: You were swapped for a future Hall of Famer.
sentences.chinese: 但請保重，大艾，這次交易將使你成爲名人堂的一員。

sentences.english: We're so sorry that you have to leave. Well, take care of yourself.
sentences.chinese: 你要走了真是太遺憾啦，那麼多保重吧。

sentences.english: Focus on cost and quality control all the time to ensure the realization of project objectives.
sentences.chinese: 時刻關注成本和質量控制，確保重點項目目標的實現。

sentences.english: It would behove you to take better care of your health.
sentences.chinese: 更好地保重你的身體健康是適宜的。

sentences.english: Lulu, take care and enjoy your new home.
sentences.chinese: 露露，保重和享受您的新家。

sentences.english: Big East brother want to take care of themselves.
sentences.chinese: 希望大東哥哥能保重身體。

sentences.english: Take care. I still love you.
Hope you're all well, take care.
sentences.chinese: 希望你們都好，多多保重。

sentences.english: My honey, i wish you a pleasant journey , and please take care.
sentences.chinese: 我親愛的，祝你一路順風，請多多保重。

definition: precious/extremely valuable/(honorific) Please take good care of yourself!
I'm sure we'll meet again some day. (idiom)/Hope to see you again.
to do one's best/to shape up/to behave/to fend for oneself/you're on your own
restrain your grief, accept fate (condolence phrase)
many thanks/thanks a lot
to have a pleasant journey/Bon voyage!
safe and sound/well
(polite) thank you for your trouble (used when asking a favor or after having received one)
if only it were so/I hope so (idiom)
goodbye/see you again later
to take leave
to let sb down/to be unfair/I'm sorry/pardon me (formal)
concerned
to tell/to exhort/injunction
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
Stay a bit!/Wait a minute!/(to a departing guest) Take care!
